_meta.description: Complete API context for Prakriti AI - Ayurvedic Diet Planning & Food Recognition App. Give this file to GitHub Copilot / AI assistant to build React Native frontend.

techStack.chatbot: FastAPI microservice with RAG (Ayurveda knowledge base)

systemPrompt: You are building a React Native mobile app for 'Prakriti AI' - an Ayurvedic diet planning, food recognition, and health tracking app. The backend API is deployed at https://prakriti-api.onrender.com/api. All authenticated endpoints require a Bearer token in the Authorization header. The token is a JWT signed with { userId } payload. All API responses follow the format: { success: boolean, message: string, data?: object }. Error responses: { success: false, message: string }. The app has these main features: Auth (signup/login), Health Profile with Ayurvedic traits, Prakriti Assessment (questionnaire-based dosha determination), Meal Planning, Food Recognition (image upload), Health Tracking (food diary, water, sleep, exercise, yoga, mood, stress, vitals, dinacharya), Dashboard Analytics, Wellness (articles, recommendations, notifications, seasonal routines), Doctor Consultation (browse doctors, book slots, video call via Jitsi Meet), and AI Chatbot (Ayurvedic diet advice). For video calling: the patient books a slot, the doctor generates a Jitsi Meet link, the patient fetches their booking detail to get the meetLink and opens it in a WebView or external browser. Use the 'canJoinCall' boolean from the booking response to show/hide the Join Video Call button.

errorResponses.409: An account with this email/username already exists.

profile.description: Health profile with Ayurvedic physical traits. All endpoints require auth + email verified.

data._comment: Returns the full HealthProfile object with all fields
Full HealthProfile object or null if not created

requestBody._comment: Any subset of profile fields to update

data._comment: Condensed profile summary with BMI, dosha info, etc.

requestBody._note: All fields are optional strings. See HealthProfile model for complete list.
All fields optional. See DoshaTraits model for complete list.

predictPrakriti.description: Runs ML model to predict Prakriti (constitution) from saved traits

predictDosha.description: Runs ML model to predict current dosha imbalance from saved traits

getPredictions.description: Get latest prakriti and dosha predictions

assessment.description: Prakriti assessment via questionnaire with dosha scoring. All endpoints require auth + verified.

completeAssessment.description: Calculates dosha scores and determines prakriti type

getDoshaProfile.description: Get the user's current dosha profile (latest completed assessment result)

mealPlan.description: Create and manage Ayurvedic meal plans. All endpoints require auth + verified.

food.description: Food database with Ayurvedic dosha suitability. Auth required, no email verification needed for browsing.

getByDosha.description: Get foods suitable for a specific dosha (VATA, PITTA, KAPHA)

requestBody._comment: Additional food fields like calories, protein, etc.

foodRecognition.description: Upload food images for AI recognition. Results can be added to food diary.

tracking.description: Comprehensive health tracking - food diary, water, sleep, exercise, yoga, mood, stress, vitals, dinacharya.

requestBody._comment: Health vitals - blood pressure, heart rate, temperature, etc.

dashboard.description: Analytics dashboard with various health metrics. All require auth + verified.

getOverview.description: Main dashboard with today's summary, recent food diary, active meal plan, notification counts

wellness.description: Wellness features - recommendations, notifications, preferences, seasonal routines, articles.

getArticles.description: Public - works without auth, but auth adds bookmark status

doctorConsultation.description: Browse doctors, view available slots, book appointments, video call via Jitsi Meet. This is the CORE feature for the React Native app's doctor booking and video calling flow.

videoCallFlow.step1_browse: Patient browses doctors → GET /doctors (public, no auth)
videoCallFlow.step2_viewSlots: Patient picks a doctor, views slots for a date → GET /doctors/:id/slots?date=2026-02-25 (public)
videoCallFlow.step3_book: Patient books an available slot → POST /doctors/:id/book (auth required)
videoCallFlow.step4_doctorGeneratesMeet: Doctor generates Jitsi meet link from doctor portal → POST /doctor-portal/bookings/:id/meet (doctor auth)
videoCallFlow.step5_patientFetchesBooking: Patient fetches bookings to see meet link → GET /doctors/bookings/my (auth required)
videoCallFlow.step6_patientJoinsCall: Patient opens meetLink in WebView or Linking.openURL() when canJoinCall === true

implementationNotes.reactNative: Use react-native-webview to open Jitsi Meet link, or use Linking.openURL(meetLink) to open in browser. For better UX, use @jitsi/react-native-sdk for native Jitsi integration.
implementationNotes.polling: Poll GET /doctors/bookings/:bookingId every 10-15 seconds to check when canJoinCall becomes true after doctor generates the meet link.
implementationNotes.noAccountNeeded: Jitsi Meet is free and requires no account for either party.

queryParams.search: Search by name, specialty, location, qualification

listDoctors.notes: rating is returned as a Decimal string from Prisma. Convert to Number in the app: Number(doctor.rating).toFixed(1)

queryParams.date: ISO date string (optional, defaults to today)
ISO date string (optional, defaults to today)

getDoctorSlots.notes: Only shows active (isActive=true) slots. isBooked=true means already taken.

slotId.description: The slot ID from getDoctorSlots response

booking.notes: First consultation for Vata dosha diet

errorResponses.400: slotId is required / Invalid slotId format / Slot does not belong to this doctor / Cannot book a slot in the past
errorResponses.409: This slot is already booked / You already have a booking with this doctor on this date

importantFields.meetLink: The Jitsi Meet URL. null until doctor generates it.
importantFields.hasMeetLink: boolean - true if doctor has generated the meet link
importantFields.canJoinCall: boolean - true ONLY if status=CONFIRMED AND meetLink exists. Use this to show/hide the Join Video Call button.
importantFields.status: CONFIRMED = active booking, CANCELLED = cancelled, COMPLETED = done, NO_SHOW = patient didn't show up

getBookingDetail.description: Use this to poll for meet link availability. Poll every 10-15 seconds after booking is confirmed.

errorResponses.403: You can only cancel your own bookings.
errorResponses.400: Cannot cancel a booking with status: COMPLETED

chatbot.description: Ayurvedic dietician chatbot powered by RAG (retrieval-augmented generation). Requires auth.

data.response: Based on your Vata constitution, I recommend warm, cooked foods...

health.description: Check if chatbot microservice is alive

videoCallIntegration.description: COMPLETE GUIDE for implementing video calling in React Native

option1_webview.description: Simple - open Jitsi in a WebView
option1_webview.usage: When canJoinCall is true, navigate to a VideoCallScreen that renders <WebView source={{ uri: meetLink }} /> with camera/mic permissions

option2_linkingUrl.note: Opens in Safari/Chrome. Less integrated but zero setup.

option3_jitsiSdk.note: Provides native UI for video calling with chat, screen share, etc.

completeFlow.action: Fetch slots for a specific date
completeFlow.uiLogic: Show available slots (isBooked=false). Grey out booked slots.
Show confirmation dialog before booking. On success, navigate to BookingsScreen.
List bookings sorted by date. Show status badge (Confirmed/Cancelled/Completed). Show 'Join Video Call' button only when canJoinCall === true.

completeFlow.action: View single booking detail + poll for meet link
completeFlow.uiLogic: Show full booking details with doctor info. If canJoinCall is false, show 'Waiting for doctor to start the call...' with a loading indicator. Poll this endpoint every 10-15 seconds. When canJoinCall becomes true, show 'Join Video Call' button.
Open meetLink in WebView or via Linking.openURL(). Request camera + microphone permissions before opening.
Only show cancel button for CONFIRMED bookings. Show confirmation dialog.

dataModels.description: Key database models relevant to the React Native app

HealthProfile._ayurvedicTraits: bodySize, complexion, skinType, hairColor, faceShape, eyes, nails, appetiteTrait, digestionSpeed, tastePreference, weatherPreference, etc.
HealthProfile._note: See full HealthProfile model in schema for all 80+ optional Ayurvedic trait fields

Doctor.name: string
Doctor.rating: Decimal (e.g., 4.5) — NOTE: Prisma returns this as a Decimal object, convert with Number(rating)

Booking.meetLink: string or null (Jitsi Meet URL, set by doctor)

_computed.hasMeetLink: boolean (true if meetLink is not null)
_computed.canJoinCall: boolean (true if status=CONFIRMED AND meetLink exists)

409_duplicate.message: A record with this field already exists.

429_rateLimited.message: Too many requests. Please try again later.

success.structure: { success: true, message: string, data: object }

reactNativeSetupNotes.apiClient: Use axios or fetch. Set baseURL to https://prakriti-api.onrender.com/api. Store JWT token in AsyncStorage or SecureStore.
reactNativeSetupNotes.authInterceptor: Add axios interceptor to attach Authorization: Bearer <token> to all requests.
reactNativeSetupNotes.imageUploads: Use FormData for multipart/form-data uploads (profile image, food recognition, assessment images).
reactNativeSetupNotes.dateHandling: All dates from API are in UTC ISO format. Convert to local time for display using new Date(isoString).toLocaleString().
reactNativeSetupNotes.decimalFields: doctor.rating is a Prisma Decimal — always convert with Number(rating) before using .toFixed() or math operations.
reactNativeSetupNotes.navigation: Suggested stack: AuthStack (Login/Signup) → MainTabs (Home/Dashboard, Doctors, Tracking, Profile) → Modal screens (Booking, VideoCall, etc.)
reactNativeSetupNotes.stateManagement: Use React Context or Zustand for auth state, React Query/TanStack Query for server state caching.
